Description: Miniature mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body, a long round-topped nozzle with a slightly splayed rounded end, and a raised circular base, flat below. The filling-hole has a raised edge, and the discus has a moulded rim. The shoulder is decorated with radiating ridges. On the left side are three raised concentric semicircles, and on top of the nozzle is a palmette. The surface is crazed, and may have a buff slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q587)
